message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper proposes a new attention framework for sequential visual tasks, which involves using a conditional global feature to represent the current focused object and measuring how convolutional features align to it. This work is relevant to computer vision (cs.CV) as well as natural language processing (cs.CL) due to its application in image captioning. Additionally, the use of recurrent structures suggests relevance to machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and neural networks (cs.NE).
